intro: Diaphanoptera, commonly known as the glasswinged butterfly, is a species of butterfly characterized by its delicate, transparent wings. The wings are mostly translucent, with only faint patterns visible, giving it a unique and ethereal appearance. It belongs to the family Nymphalidae and is found in tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant aspect refers to its host plants, which include various species of plants in the Malvaceae family. Its life cycle involves laying eggs on these host plants, from which the larvae feed and develop.
